intro: Bunias altaica, commonly known as the Siberian mustard, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lobed leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, typical of the mustard family. Bunias altaica is adapted to harsh environments, often found in rocky or arctic regions.
